dcterms:creator: E. M. Elder
M. Hayes
dcterms:description: A dataset comprising 1,000 common American first names rated with respect to group identities (i.e., race/ethnicity and gender) and traits (e.g., aggressive, hardworking).
dcterms:title: Name-Trait Perceptions Dataset

dcterms:creator: N. Reimers
I. Gurevych
dcterms:description: A model that generates sentence embeddings using Siamese BERT-Networks, allowing for the comparison of sentence similarity.
dcterms:title: Sentence-BERT

dcterms:creator: M. Nadeem
A. Bethke
S. Reddy
dcterms:description: A dataset designed to measure stereotypical bias in pretrained language models, providing a benchmark for evaluating bias in NLP systems.
dcterms:title: StereoSet

dcterms:creator: J. F. Rauthmann
D. Gallardo-Pujol
E. M. Guillaume
E. Todd
C. S. Nave
R. A. Sherman
M. Ziegler
A. B. Jones
D. C. Funder
dcterms:description: A taxonomy of major dimensions of situation characteristics, providing a framework for understanding situational influences on behavior.
dcterms:title: DIAMONDS Taxonomy

dcterms:creator: C. M. Judd
C. S. Ryan
B. Park
dcterms:description: A study examining the accuracy in the judgment of in-group and out-group variability, contributing to the understanding of social perception.
dcterms:title: Out-group Homogeneity Effect

dcterms:creator: B. Park
C. M. Judd
dcterms:description: A framework for measuring and modeling perceived group variability, contributing to the understanding of social identity and perception.
dcterms:title: Perceived Group Variability

dcterms:creator: M. H. J. Lee
J. M. Montgomery
C. K. Lai
dcterms:description: A study investigating how large language models portray socially subordinate groups as more homogeneous, reflecting a bias observed in humans.
dcterms:title: Homogeneity Bias in LLMs
